intro: Hieracium kalmii var. magnilacustre, commonly known as the lake meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along lake shores, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a low-growing habit with numerous stems and is often found in wetland habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
